str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Blood, literally, figuratively or specially; by implication, bloodshed, also kindred.
A he-goat. From the base of trogo; a he-goat.
A bull, an ox. Apparently a primary word; a bullock.
A heifer, young cow. Probably from the base of damazo; a heifer.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To sprinkle, cleanse ceremonially by sprinkling. From a derivative of rhaino; to render besprinkled, i.e. Asperse.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To make unclean, pollute, desecrate, mid: I regard (treat) as unclean. From koinos; to make profane.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From hagios; to make holy, i.e. purify or consecrate; to venerate.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.
